response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Integer> it = newlist.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    int currentElement = it.next();
    if(currentElement > firstElement) {
        // store in one array
    } else {
        // store in another arraylist
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an iterator to iterate through the elements of the ArrayList and compare each element to the first element. If the element is greater than the first element, you can store it in one array, otherwise store it in another arraylist.
